source.title: Subhāṣitas
source.description: Short aphoristic verses conveying wisdom. Their brevity and self-contained nature make them ideal for beginning readers.

passages.title: The Fruit of Learning
passages.sanskrit:
विद्या ददाति विनयं विनयाद्याति पात्रताम् ।
पात्रत्वाद्धनमाप्नोति धनाद्धर्मं ततः सुखम् ॥
passages.padaccheda: विद्या ददाति विनयम् विनयात् याति पात्रताम् पात्रत्वात् धनम् आप्नोति धनात् धर्मम् ततः सुखम्
passages.transliteration:
vidyā dadāti vinayaṃ vinayād yāti pātratām |
pātratvād dhanam āpnoti dhanād dharmaṃ tataḥ sukham ||
passages.translation: Learning gives humility; from humility comes worthiness; from worthiness one obtains wealth; from wealth, dharma; and from that, happiness.
passages.grammarNotes:
A chain of ablatives showing cause and effect:

1. **Ablative of source/cause**: विनयात्, पात्रत्वात्, धनात् - "from X" showing what leads to what

2. **Abstract noun formation**: पात्रता "worthiness" (from पात्र + ता suffix)

3. **Present tense verbs**: ददाति (√दा, 3rd class), याति (√या), आप्नोति (√आप्, 5th class)

passages.title: The Test of Friendship
passages.sanskrit:
आपदि मित्रपरीक्षा शूरपरीक्षा रणाङ्गणे ।
विनये वंशपरीक्षा शीलपरीक्षा धनक्षये ॥
passages.padaccheda: आपदि मित्र-परीक्षा शूर-परीक्षा रण-अङ्गणे विनये वंश-परीक्षा शील-परीक्षा धन-क्षये
passages.transliteration:
āpadi mitra-parīkṣā śūra-parīkṣā raṇāṅgaṇe |
vinaye vaṃśa-parīkṣā śīla-parīkṣā dhana-kṣaye ||
passages.translation: In calamity is the test of a friend; in the battlefield, the test of a hero; in conduct, the test of lineage; in loss of wealth, the test of character.
passages.grammarNotes:
This verse is a series of locative-nominative pairs:

1. **Locative of circumstance**: आपदि "in calamity", रणाङ्गणे "on the battlefield", विनये "in conduct", धनक्षये "in loss of wealth"

2. **Tatpuruṣa compounds**: मित्रपरीक्षा "test of a friend" (genitive tatpuruṣa)

3. **Nominal sentence**: No verb - the structure is "in X [is] the Y" (implied अस्ति)

passages.title: Truth and Kindness
passages.sanskrit:
सत्यं ब्रूयात् प्रियं ब्रूयात् न ब्रूयात् सत्यमप्रियम् ।
प्रियं च नानृतं ब्रूयात् एष धर्मः सनातनः ॥
passages.padaccheda: सत्यम् ब्रूयात् प्रियम् ब्रूयात् न ब्रूयात् सत्यम् अप्रियम् प्रियम् च न अनृतम् ब्रूयात् एषः धर्मः सनातनः
passages.transliteration:
satyaṃ brūyāt priyaṃ brūyāt na brūyāt satyam apriyam |
priyaṃ ca nānṛtaṃ brūyāt eṣa dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ ||
passages.translation: One should speak the truth; one should speak pleasantly; one should not speak truth that is unpleasant; nor should one speak pleasant falsehood—this is the eternal dharma.
passages.grammarNotes:
Optative (vidhi-liṅ) expressing prescription:

1. **Optative mood**: ब्रूयात् "one should speak" - 3rd person singular optative of √ब्रू

2. **Negation patterns**: न ब्रूयात् "one should not speak"

3. **Sandhi**: नानृतम् = न + अनृतम् (vowel sandhi)

passages.title: Time Devours All
passages.sanskrit:
कालः पचति भूतानि कालः संहरते प्रजाः ।
कालः सुप्तेषु जागर्ति कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः ॥
passages.padaccheda: कालः पचति भूतानि कालः संहरते प्रजाः कालः सुप्तेषु जागर्ति कालः हि दुरतिक्रमः
passages.transliteration:
kālaḥ pacati bhūtāni kālaḥ saṃharate prajāḥ |
kālaḥ supteṣu jāgarti kālo hi duratikramaḥ ||
passages.translation: Time cooks (ripens/destroys) beings; Time gathers up creatures; Time stays awake while [all] sleep; Time indeed is hard to overcome.
passages.grammarNotes:
Personification through present tense verbs:

1. **Active present**: पचति "cooks", जागर्ति "stays awake"

2. **Middle present**: संहरते "gathers to itself" (ātmanepada)

3. **Locative absolute sense**: सुप्तेषु "while [beings are] asleep" - locative plural of the past participle

4. **Bahuvrīhi compound**: दुरतिक्रमः "hard to cross over" = दुस् + अतिक्रम
